meanings.def: hard; not in the form of a liquid or gas
examples: The planet Jupiter may have no solid surface at all.
The boat bumped against a solid object.
She had refused all solid food.
the collection and disposal of solid waste
It was so cold that the stream had frozen solid.
The boiler uses solid fuel (= for example, coal).
The ice felt solid enough.
Under her bare toes the floor felt real and solid.

meanings.def: having no holes or spaces inside; not hollow
examples: They were drilling through solid rock.
He flung open the solid wood door.
The stores are packed solid (= very full and crowded) at this time of year.
The national boundary is shown on the map as a solid line.

meanings.def: made completely of the material mentioned (that is, the material is not only on the surface)
examples: a solid gold bracelet
Each piece is individually made in solid silver.
These chains seem fairly solid.
The door was solid as rock.

meanings.def: that you can rely on; having a strong basis
examples: As yet, they have no solid evidence.
His advice was always solid and practical.
This provided a solid foundation for their marriage.
We've established a really solid base for our products.
The Irish team were solid as a rock in defence.

meanings.def: definitely good and steady but perhaps not excellent or special
examples: 2017 was a year of solid achievement.
Both leading actors put in a solid performance.
He's a good solid player.
The songwriting quality is consistently solid.
Trade remained solid throughout the year.
The essay represents a solid week's work.
It rained for two hours solid this afternoon.

meanings.def: of the colour mentioned and no other colour
examples: One cat is black and white, the other solid black.

meanings.def: a shape that is solid has length, width and height and is not flat
examples: A cube is a solid figure.

meanings.def: in complete agreement; agreed on by everyone
examples: The department was solid against the changes.
The strike was solid, supported by all the members.

meanings.def: to be in a strong position in an argument, etc. because you know the facts
examples: Everyone agreed with me, so I knew I was on firm ground.
He is probably on solid ground when he says we need more training.

idioms.def: to be in a strong position in an argument, etc. because you know the facts
examples: Everyone agreed with me, so I knew I was on firm ground.
He is probably on solid ground when he says we need more training.

meanings.def: a substance or an object that is solid, not a liquid or a gas
examples: liquids and solids
on solids The baby is not yet on solids (= eating solid food).
Is calcium carbonate normally a solid or a liquid?

meanings.def: a shape that has length, width and height, such as a cube
